h3. Problem Definition
Currently, CATALINA_BASE and CATALINA_HOME are in the same location. As per recommendations from https://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-8.0-doc/RUNNING.txt :
bq. Using distinct values for the CATALINA_HOME and CATALINA_BASE variables is recommended to simplify further upgrades and maintenance.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have an independent CATALINA_BASE and CATALINA_HOME
fields.summary: As an Admin, I would like to have an independent CATALINA_BASE and CATALINA_HOME

fields.description:
h3. Summary
There are hundreds of warnings on how JIRA can be improved using Google Chrome Development Tool's Audit feature. 

h3. Environment
* Google Chrome

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access JIRA using Google Chrome
# Access an issue
# Open the Development Tool ( F12 ) 
# Select the Audit Tab 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Select "Reload Page and Audit on Load" > Run


h3. Expected Results
There should be no warnings

h3. Actual Results
Among the warnings: 
!screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
{code}
Combine external CSS (5)
Combine external JavaScript (12)
Leverage browser caching (12)
Minimize cookie size
Serve static content from a cookieless domain (13)
Specify image dimensions (23)
Web Page Performance
Optimize the order of styles and scripts (7)
Remove unused CSS rules (4189)
 {code}
fields.summary: Google Chrome Development Tools Audit Warnings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63920].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently when we allow JIRA instance to be public so that our users can access it from any part of the world, anonymous user who does not have access to JIRA instance or does not even related to our JIRA instance able to access to the managed filter page as well as filters (which is shared with everyone- there is a feature request at [JRA-63890|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-63890] to provide improvement on this) 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide Feature for JIRA Administrator to Configure Which Link should be Shown and Which Link Should be Hidden from search engines

h3. Why this is important
Such bottleneck in JIRA can potentially cause security issue to the data hosted in our JIRA instance as anonymous users able to browse up to filter level when JIRA is made available to be accessed via internet from anywhere.

h3. Workaround 
Use robot.txt as mentioned in [Using robots.txt to hide from search engines|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/using-robots-txt-to-hide-from-search-engines-802593007.html].
fields.summary: Ability to Configure Links that Should be Visible and Hidden in JIRA Instance

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA ServiceDesk icons are missing when linking issues to each other and when viewing the issue types from the issue type screen. 

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Navigate to Versions and Licenses. 
# Uninstall ServiceDesk. 
# Navigate to _Issue Types_ OR
# Any issue and attempt to link it to another issue

h3. Expected Results

ServiceDesk Issue type icons should appear in both the _Issue Types_ screen as well as the dropdown when linking tickets. 

h3. Actual Results 

ServiceDesk Issue type icons seem to be broken. 

h3. Workaround

Re-install JIRA ServiceDesk, which will re-upload the icons again. 


_This problem seems to be *reproducible* on a fresh instance of JIRA as well, however, it is very *inconsistent* at the moment when testing it out with *different versions* of ServiceDesk. Managed to reproduce it on 3.2.6. and 3.2.7._
fields.summary: ServiceDesk icons broken when ServiceDesk is uninstalled

h3. Summary

The documentation for [Creating issues using the csv importer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver072/creating-issues-using-the-csv-importer-829057518.html] has a section for attachments, but the bulk create from CSV does not support attachments.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.2.3 Docs

h3. Expected Results

Documentation for the Issue -> Import from CSV functionality should not reference attachments.

h3. Actual Results

The documentation [Creating issues using the csv importer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver072/creating-issues-using-the-csv-importer-829057518.html] has a section for importing attachments via CSV.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
 # Create SMTP mail Server
 2. Setup POP/IMAP mail server and a *create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue* mail handler and check the *CC Watchers* field
 3. Send an email with the cc field to some other email address(which the user is register in JIRA) to the mail server and JIRA expectedly create a issue from it and added cc field email address into watchers of that issue.
 4. After that, if continue to reply that email it will actually comment on that issue however if the cc field of the mail address is added some other email address, it won't add those email address as watchers.

Use case:
 # We are currently using JIRA as a CRM tool and as a result we want to quickly loop in other JIRA users onto a ticket for visibility and response
 # However with the current setup this is not possible and if the team is travelling, they are not able to access JIRA without being on VPN to add addtional watchers.
fields.summary: Add people as watchers via email CC once a ticket has already been created?

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In the Rich Text Editor Documentation for JIRA 7.2:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver072/visual-editing-838542506.html

The Notation states:
{quote}
Visual editing is part of a Labs feature in JIRA platform 7.2. Labs features can be turned off by your administrator, so if you don't have access to visual editing, that's probably why.
{quote}

BUT Labs functionality changed in 7.2 and the only documentation for enabling labs features is for 7.0:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARESERVER070/JIRA+Software+Labs
-- this document notes the labs features are under >> Administration > Applications > JIRA software Labs

This LABS sub menu no longer exists as of jira 7.2 and the *Rich Text Editor* Labs Feature was given its own Sub Menu under:
- Administration >> System >> USER INTERFACE >> Rich Text Editor
- OR >> G+G "Rich Text Editor"

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the 7.2 and newer Visual editor Documentation to Include locations of the rich text editor menu:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver072/visual-editing-838542506.html
{quote}
Visual editing is part of a Labs feature in JIRA platform 7.2. Labs features can be turned off by your administrator, so if you don't have access to visual editing, that's probably why.

The Feature can be enabled and disabled under *Administration* >> *System* >> *USER INTERFACE* >> *Rich Text Editor*    OR    *G+G* search for "Rich Text Editor"
{quote}
fields.summary: Rich Text Editor Documentation Correction

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63907].
  {panel}

h3. What

Add a new column to the fileattachment table in the JIRA database called "hash" and store in there the SHA256 hash (or even MD5) of the file.

 
h3. Why

By adding this column, plugins for JIRA will be able to add significant new functionality to Jira. Future versions of JIRA will also be able to leverage this to achieve:
 * Prevent the same attachment being added many times to the same issue (for example, logos from inbound email)
 * Deduplicate attachment storage
 * Integrity checking that the attachment on disk is unmodified
 * Blacklist certain attachments from being added to the system (eg. again logos in inbound emails)
fields.summary: Add SHA hash to fileattachment table

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63890].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently there is no proper documentation that explain the *anyone* permission which is available to be used in Filters and dashboard.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide Documentation explaining the use case of these permission so that the users who are using this permission will have better understanding on the expected behavior from the usage of this permission.

h3. Why this is important
Currently a normal JIRA user expect that *anyone* permission is only applicable for all the users who are registered for an account in their JIRA instance however they are not aware that this permission can allow anonymous users who are not related to JIRA can view all the shared objects that is using *anyone* permission. This behavior causes some serious security breach concern as well as misunderstanding in users end.
fields.summary: Provide Documentation Explaining The Usage Of Filter Permission

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63881].
  {panel}

h3. Problem definition
Certain searches causes Google to index duplicate JIRA urls. 

h6. For Example:
Using -> site:https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-62251
 !example-site.png|thumbnail! 

This happens because both pages return *200*, which is the reason Google indexes both pages. This in return harms SEO rankings on Google.

h3. Suggested Solution
#  Update JIRA to return *301* in the relevant cases, for example, when retrieving the results for an issue through the issue view.
# JIRA should be able to use canonical in the relevant cases to identify duplicates. 
#* [Google-Use canonical URLs|https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/139066?hl=en]

h3. workaround
# Use seo tools to filter out url patterns that google detects as duplicate.
# [Use robots.txt to hide from search engines|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/using-robots-txt-to-hide-from-search-engines-802593007.html]
fields.summary: JIRA causing duplicate pages to be indexed in Google
Support background colors in wiki rendering
Create Dark theme for JIRA self hosted
Show the new target dates (start and end) fields from Portfolio in JIRA
Clarification Needed on Supported Platforms

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When pasting a screenshot into the comment field of an issue using the visual editor, it appears to render correctly, but when saving the comment it does not save correctly, giving a 'Unable to render embedded object' error:

 !unable_to_render.png! 

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.3.x
* JIRA 7.2.x with the Rich Text Editor Labs feature enabled.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enabled RTE if on JIRA 7.2.x
# Copy an image into your clipboard.
# Add a new comment in Visual mode, and paste your screenshot in.
# Save your comment.
# If the problem can't be reproduced, try editing the comment and adding the screenshot again

h3. Expected Results

The screenshot will render as it appears in the visual editor.

h3. Actual Results

You receive the following error:

 !unable_to_render.png! 

h3. Notes:
* The issue will behave differently in IE.
* Tested using JIRA 7.4.0 using Chrome v60.0.3112.101 (Official Build) (64-bit) and 59.0.3071.115 (Official Build) (64-bit), the behavior will be shown like below in *IE*:
 !Screen Shot 2017-08-16 at 7.56.10 PM.png|thumbnail!
* Following the same steps as above in IE the image is rendered properly both in IE and Chrome.
 
h3.Workaround

* To use the function to "Browse for file" or _Drag 'n Drop_. to upload the images (without copy/paste).
* Use the "Text" mode or disable RTE to remove the "Visual" mode.
fields.summary: Pasted Screenshots Fail To Render In Visual Editor

h3. Summary
When scrolling through an issue, the Summary top panel does not freeze on the screen. It scrolls with the screen.

h3. Environment
# In JIRA 7.1.10 (as well as 6.4.11), it was possible to freeze the Summary at the top of the screen.
# In JIRA 7.3, the Summary field is scrolling with the screen. It does not stay on the screen.

 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to an issue on the browser on JIRA 7.3. Its better if the issue has a few comments so you can scroll on the page. (Tested on this site)
# Scroll through the issue
# The Summary field does not stay on the screen

h3. Expected Results
The Summary field should stay on the screen just like earlier versions.

h3. Actual Results
The Summary field does not stay on the screen.
fields.summary: While scrolling issue on Issue view screen, does not freeze the Summary panel at the top

h3. Summary
JIRA is very slow or inaccessible. Almost all incoming http threads are blocked waiting for cache {{getUsersSecurityLevels}} to be populated.
Problem could be caused by two factors:
* Too frequent cache flush
* Slow cache population

h3. Environment
* Large number of issue: 1M+
* Large number of users: 50k+
* High concurrent load: 300 request/min 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# TBD

h3. Expected Results
JIRA can handle high load

h3. Actual Results
JIRA is very slow. 
Thread-dump will show that there are a lot of threads in {{java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING}} state waiting for cache.
 
h3. Notes
Please note that *doAddUserToGroup()* or *addActorsToProjectRole()* will cause flush of the {{projectAndUserToSecurityLevelCache}} cache.

More detailed break-down from thread dump

* Number of threads and state: based on Future 0000001303b43078
{code:borderStyle=solid}
find ./ -name '*.td' | xargs -n 1 -I %  sh -c '/bin/echo -n %; grep -B 3 -A 20 0000001303b43078 % | grep -e java.lang.Thread.State | sed 's/prio.*//' |sort | uniq -c '
.//jira_threads.1484815453.txt1.td 214    java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
.//jira_threads.1484815466.txt1.td 208    java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
.//jira_threads.1484815479.txt1.td 212    java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
.//jira_threads.1484815492.txt1.td 
   1    java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
   211    java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
.//jira_threads.1484815505.txt1.td 191    java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
.//jira_threads.1484815518.txt1.td 178    java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
{code}
* Number of threads and state with {{getUsersSecurityLevels}} method, majority of the thread doing getUsersSecurityLevels are waiting for cache. 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
find ./ -name '*.td' | xargs -n 1 -I %  sh -c '/bin/echo -n %; grep -B 20 com.atlassian.jira.issue.security.IssueSecurityLevelManagerImpl.getUsersSecurityLevels % | grep -e java.lang.Thread.State | sort | uniq -c '
.//jira_threads.1484815453.txt1.td 295    java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
.//jira_threads.1484815466.txt1.td 295    java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
.//jira_threads.1484815479.txt1.td   1    java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
 307    java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
.//jira_threads.1484815492.txt1.td   1    java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
 302    java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
.//jira_threads.1484815505.txt1.td 266    java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
.//jira_threads.1484815518.txt1.td 257    java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
{code}
* Overall {{getUsersSecurityLevels}} in thread dumps (quick check):
{code:borderStyle=solid}
grep -c 'com.atlassian.jira.issue.security.IssueSecurityLevelManagerImpl.getUsersSecurityLevels' *.td

jira_threads.1484815453.txt1.td:590
jira_threads.1484815466.txt1.td:590
jira_threads.1484815479.txt1.td:616
jira_threads.1484815492.txt1.td:606
jira_threads.1484815505.txt1.td:534
jira_threads.1484815518.txt1.td:516
{code}

Example of the thread:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
"ajp-nio-8009-exec-1654" #794541 daemon prio=5 tid=0x00007f563d925000 nid=0xd431  waiting on condition   
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(ZJ)V(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x0000001303b43078> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock$FairSync)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(Ljava/lang/Object;)V(LockSupport.java:175)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.parkAndCheckInterrupt()Z(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:836)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.doAcquireShared(I)V(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:967)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquireShared(I)V(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:1283)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock$ReadLock.lock()V(ReentrantReadWriteLock.java:751)
	at com.atlassian.cache.memory.BlockingCacheLoader.load(Ljava/lang/Object;)Ljava/lang/Object;(BlockingCacheLoader.java:50)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$LoadingValueReference.loadFuture(Ljava/lang/Object;Lcom/google/common/cache/CacheLoader;)Lcom/google/common/util/concurrent/ListenableFuture;(LocalCache.java:3573)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.loadSync(Ljava/lang/Object;ILcom/google/common/cache/LocalCache$LoadingValueReference;Lcom/google/common/cache/CacheLoader;)Ljava/lang/Object;(LocalCache.java:2350)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.lockedGetOrLoad(Ljava/lang/Object;ILcom/google/common/cache/CacheLoader;)Ljava/lang/Object;(LocalCache.java:2313)
	- locked <0x0000001085e4a360> (a com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$StrongAccessEntry)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.get(Ljava/lang/Object;ILcom/google/common/cache/CacheLoader;)Ljava/lang/Object;(LocalCache.java:2228)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache.get(Ljava/lang/Object;Lcom/google/common/cache/CacheLoader;)Ljava/lang/Object;(LocalCache.java:3970)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache.getOrLoad(Ljava/lang/Object;)Ljava/lang/Object;(LocalCache.java:3974)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$LocalManualCache.get(Ljava/lang/Object;)Ljava/lang/Object;(LocalCache.java:4834)
	at com.atlassian.cache.memory.DelegatingCache$DelegatingLoadingCache.get(Ljava/lang/Object;)Ljava/lang/Object;(DelegatingCache.java:324)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.security.IssueSecurityLevelManagerImpl.getUsersSecurityLevels(Lorg/ofbiz/core/entity/GenericValue;Lcom/atlassian/crowd/embedded/api/User;)Ljava/util/List;(IssueSecurityLevelManagerImpl.java:225)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.security.IssueSecurityLevelManagerImpl.getUsersSecurityLevels(Lcom/atlassian/jira/project/Project;Lcom/atlassian/crowd/embedded/api/User;)Ljava/util/List;(IssueSecurityLevelManagerImpl.java:272)
...
{code}

h3.Workaround
* While working on support case we identified that problem was caused by too frequent cache flush events.
** Large amount of cache flush events were triggered by SOAP calls to JIRA from integration framework.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63861].
  {panel}

Two packages in JIRA's Java API seem to provide interfaces that would allow a plugin to manipulate the OAuth consumers/providers. This would allow plugins to provide a much better configuration experience than manual configuration of OAuth consumers/providers. The 2 packages are:
* https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/server/com/atlassian/jira/oauth/consumer/package-summary.html
* https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/server/com/atlassian/jira/oauth/serviceprovider/package-summary.html

Unfortunately, these document nothing more than the list of Classes and Methods. Since there's no link to the common package for `com.atlassian.oauth`, it is impossible to figure out how to provide the correct parameters for key methods, like `put()`.
fields.summary: Document Java APIs for OAuth

fields.description:
JIRA 7.2 changed how customfield gets rendered using the `NEW_CONTENT_ADDED` event. It was a pain before but now, it is unmanageable and causes a lot of issues in IE/Edge and sometimes in Firefox (browser freeze). For a simple static field, rendering is completely done on server and it works fine. However, for fields having complex logic on the client side, it's not working at all.

Before 7.2, it was possible to apply different hacks. In 7.2 and beyond, freezing issues are unavoidable, especially since you started to be able to browse issues on the project view.
There is no solid and simple way (at least that I am aware of) to properly determine when your field is being rendered or discarded from the screen. In order to initialize my field on the client-side, I need to rely on JIRA.bind. One of the major problem is that as the user browse issues, I keep attaching watchers and I am never notified when the field is removed from the page so I cannot remove the watchers. This causes a multiplication of watchers which ends up freezing the browser. Also, sometimes, call backs do not get called in specific views (e.g. Dialogs).
fields.summary: Client-side rendering with NEW_CONTENT_ADDED is broken

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Exported CSV file from JIRA with issues that contain multi-line description can't be properly imported into Microsoft Excel. 
 Only way to open CSV files with multi-lines in Microsoft Excel is to do so with "Open" option, which doesn't recognize UTF-8 encoding and can expect different separator than comma (,) depending on region set in operating system.

CSV export from JIRA currently can't be customized. It is always encoded in UTF-8 and has separators fixed to comma (,).
h3. Environment
 * Tested with Microsoft Excel 2016 for MacOS 10.11.1
 * JIRA 7.3.0

h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create new issue that has:
 ** Multi-line description
 ** Some regional characters (e.g. žéíýšáčúřÚňěČąęćśźżłóń) in description or summary
 # From the issue navigator, export the issue to a CSV file (e.g. Export > CSV (All fields))
 # Case 1:
 ** Open CSV in Microsoft Excel 2016.
 # Case 2:
 ** Import CSV into Microsoft Excel 2016
 *** Select delimited columns
 *** Select UTF-8 as encoding
 *** Select comma as delimiter

h3. Expected result

In at least one case Excel should show data in proper cells while rendering correctly all of regional characters.
h3. Actual result

Case 1: Data will go to proper cells if region in operating system is set to one that uses commas as delimiter in CSV. UTF-8 encoding is always not recognized.

Case 2: New lines in multi-lined text split rows making data go to improper cells
h3. Workarounds
h4. Workaround 1

Open CSV file in other spreadsheet software (e.g. [LibreOffice|https://www.libreoffice.org/] or [Google Spreadsheets|https://www.google.com/sheets/about/]) and export it to XLS or XLSX file
h4. Workaround 2
 # At the beginning of the CSV file put
{code:java}
 sep=,{code}

 # Use some external tool to change file's encoding to some that would be recognized by Excel
 # Open new file directly into Excel

h4. Workaround 3
 # Open the CSV file with Notepad (default text editor in Windows)
 # Click File -> Save as -> Ensure Encoding is UTF-8 -> Save
 # Open the new file with Excel

h4. Alternative solutions

Plug-in [Better Excel Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.midori.jira.plugin.betterexcel/server/overview] provides native Excel export via XLSX files.

h4. Reference
[Exported CSV does not display properly in Excel that contains non-English characters|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/exported-csv-does-not-display-properly-in-excel-that-contains-non-english-characters-874626219.html]
fields.summary: Can't open exported CSV in Microsoft Excel

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63854].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Unable to remove group from default member of project role when group was added using different case than actual group name.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Example 1:
 # Create a local mixed case group, example: {{abCd}}
 # Go to Administration > System > Project roles
 # Choose any of the project roles, then click on _Manage Default Members_
 # Under _Default Groups_ click on Edit
 # Add the group by typing the group name {{abcd}} in the text field
 # Try to remove the group

Example 2:
 # Create a lower case group, example: {{testgroup}}
 # Go to Administration > System > Project roles
 # Choose any of the project roles, then click on _Manage Default Members_
 # Under _Default Groups_ click on Edit
 # Add the group by typing the group name in the text field. Type group name using upper case or mixed case.
 # Try to remove the group

h3. Expected Results

Group will be removed
h3. Actual Results

Group cannot be removed. Attempting to remove group causes page to refresh, group does not get removed.
h3. Notes
 * The Bug does not affect mixed case groups alone. It affects all groups (jira-software-users is affected if you enter Jira-Software-Users)
 * The problem occurs when the case of the group name entered into the text field does not exactly match the name of the group
 ** Group name foo; you enter foo (/)
 ** Group name foo; you enter Foo (x)
 ** Group name Foo; you enter Foo (/)

h3. Workaround

*To prevent this issue, add the group via the group picker instead of typing name.*

To remove groups that cannot be removed in the UI: (Server only)
 # Obtain ID of role that needs to be edited
 ** On the page where you remove the group, look at the URL and note "projectRoleId" that appears
 # [Back up your data |https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/adminjiraserver073/Backing+Up+Data]
 # Shutdown JIRA
 # In database, {{SELECT * FROM projectroleactor WHERE pid IS NULL and projectroleid = <projectRoleId>;}}
 ** Replace <projectRoleId> with the ID obtained in step 1.
 ** This will return the entries for that project role.
 # For each entry that needs to be removed:
 ** {{DELETE FROM projectroleactor WHERE id = <id of row>;}}
 ** Replace <id of row> with the ID of the row that contains the group name that needs to be removed.
 # Start JIRA
 # Navigate to default project role members page and confirm appropriate groups appear.

Cloud customers should contact support to have the group(s) removed.
fields.summary: Cannot remove group from default project role members when added with wrong case

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63853].
  {panel}

+Issue Summary+

Following the release of JIRA 7.2, the option to *collect users Browser info* became optional allowing user to opt-in to it or not for this information to be collected.

+The Problem+

Due to the position of this checkbox being at the bottom of the page, it is possible for users to miss this without checking it and because of that, it could make troubleshooting the problem difficult for the JIRA team.

+What We Need+

Can an exact reason this was changed from automatically collecting information to allowing user opt-in be added into the documentation to help clarify things?
fields.summary: Issue Collector Documentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
# JIRA issues does not contain the field "mentioned in" which shows the confluence pages that has a link to that issue. 
# This only happens when the Confluence page includes a Jira filter which results are more than one issue.

h3. Environment
# JIRA 7.3.0
# Confluence 6.0.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Application link JIRA and Confluence
# Create a few issues in a JIRA project ( ROCK in this example ) 
# Change one of the issue's status to Done
# Create a page in Confluence 
# Insert the JIRA issue macro using JQL search which returns multiple issues for example :
{code}
project = TEST
{code}
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The added JIRA issue should display the "mentioned in" information on  the Issue Links section of the JIRA Issue view screen

h3. Actual Results
The Issue Links section does not display at all
 
h3. Notes
If there is only one issue returned on the JQL search for the JIRA Issue Macro, the "mentioned in" information on the Issue Links section works as expected. For example : 
{code}
project = TEST AND status=Done
{code}
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JIRA issue macro with more than 1 issue in Confluence does not link the page to JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When user sent email with a 2 different issue key to a Mail Handler's folder, JIRA adds process the email based on the first issue key.

Steps to reproduce:

# Setup a test Gmail.
# Create 2 different folder in Gmail (Test A & Test B).
# Create 2 projects in JIRA : Test A and Test B
# Create a Mail Server in JIRA with the test Gmail.
# Create 2 Mail handler name Test A and Test B. Configure Test A folder from Gmail with Test A Mail handler and project Test A. Configure Test B folder from Gmail with Test B Mail handler and project Test B. 
# User can configure some filtering ninja to automatically add the issues with specific subject to the Test A and Test B. For sake of testing, you can move the issue manually.
# Create a new issue in project Test A and Test B. For example, the issue keys of the 2 new issues will be TA-1 and TB-1.
# Send email to the Test A mail handler. Email should contain the subject {{TB-1, TA-1}} and the body should have the same content as well.
# Move the email from the Gmail to the {{Test A}} folder and wait for Mail Handler to process the email.
# A new comment will be added to the TB-1 even though email was processed from Mail handler Test A.


h3. Environment

JIRA 7.3.0


h3. Expected Results

JIRA process the email and add the content of the email as comment in TA-1


h3. Actual Results

JIRA process the email and add the content of the email as comment in TB-1


h3.Workaround

Add the intended issue key first to the subject and email body. For example, if the user is sending email to Test A Mail Handler, the email should look like:

Subject : TA-1 TB-1
Content : TA-1 TB-1
fields.summary: Incorrect email processing when 2 issue keys present in the email subject

h3. Summary
If we have a workflow with *one step*, using update field value post function does not take any effect

h3. Environment

* JIRA version 7.0.10
* JIRA version 7.3.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Workflow with one step. For example once create the workflow straight away goes to done status
# Add post function *update field value* and set resolution=done.
# Publish the workflow

(i) *Use Case*: Once a ticket is created the resolution is automatically set to *done*

h3. Expected Results
Create a new issue and the issue is closed automatically with resolution set as *done*

h3. Actual Results
The newly created ticket has a resolution of *unresolved*, update field value post function seems like does not take effect.

h3. Note
If the workflow have 2 step or more the post function work as expected.
fields.summary: Cannot Update Resolution Field Using Post Function Update Field Value

h3. Summary
When opening issue from a saved filter and perform Inline edit, the first time it works fine but once we reload the issue the inline edit stops working.

h3. Environment
* JIRA version 7.2.4
* JIRA version 7.3.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Issue Navigator and save a filter
# Open the filter and change the view to *list* view
# Click on any issue whereby you will be viewing issue in this url format *https://yourserver/jira/browse/issuekey?filter=10001*
# Try to inline edit the available field to edit. (you will be able to edit)
# Refresh the page and try to inline edit the field again. (you wont be able to edit now)

h3. Expected Results
You should be able to perform inline edit even after refresh the page

h3. Actual Results
The inline edit is not working after refreshing the page

h3.Workaround
Open issue in view issue page to perform inline edit.
fields.summary: Inline Issue Edit Doesn't Work when Editing Issue from Saved Filter

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In JIRA datacenter, LexoRank Rebalance causes read/write amplifications on Lucene which may cause performance degradation if cluster doesn't have IO/CPU capacity. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA Datacenter 
* Large number of issues 1M+
* Large number of custom fields: 1k+

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup JIRA Datacenter
# Trigger or wait for LexoRank Rebalance

h3. Expected Results
JIRA Datacenter performance will be not affected and no replication lag

h3. Actual Results
JIRA Datacenter performance could be affected and there will be replication lag. That will cause data discrepancy between nodes. 
You will have following health-check error:
{code}
["Index replication for cluster node 'node3' is behind by 2,991 seconds.","Index replication for cluster node 'node1' is behind by 1,501 seconds.","Index replication for cluster node 'node2_0004' is behind by 2,123 seconds."]
{code}
 
h3. Notes
Problem is caused by set of conditions/problems:
* LexoRank Rebalancing requires rebalancing of all records in Rank field
* In case of JDC that required reindexing of all issues with all related customfields/comments
* That causes read and write amplification, as all nodes needs to update their Lucene index for all issues
* JDC uses same {{replicatedindexoperation}} mechanism for all updates.
** That means that critical replication updates from at other nodes initiated by user action compete with non-urgent _LexoRank_ updates. 

h3. Workarounds
* Reduce the number of nodes in the cluster. Testing reveals diminishing returns in performance in clusters larger than 4 nodes.
* Avoid closing a sprint with > 200 issues in an unresolved status. This requires a new Rank value for all these issues and can trigger a Lexorank rebalance.
* If you are planning to import hundreds of issues, delay this until you have tested and resolved performance bottlenecks. A Rank must be generated for every issue and this can trigger a Lexorank rebalance.
* Leave only one node in LB to prevent serving stale data from other nodes. This negates the high availability value of Data Center so is considered a last resort. This also requires that each node is capable of handling the full concurrent user traffic for your organization, as is the best practice for an HA cluster.

Full details on workarounds and solutions are available at [JIRAKB/JIRA Software Data Center Lexorank Indexing Lag|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+Software+Data+Center+Lexorank+Indexing+Lag].

h3. Note on Fix
Problem mitigation:
* We have worked on reducing the need of LexoRank balancing being triggered (JSW-15710). 
* Also a number of improvements to LexoRank balancing has been implemented that reduce impact of it running on JIRA cluster. 
** We have addressed replication lag in JSW-15703. 

That said, a running LexoRank balancing will still cause some read and write amplification. More details about resolution are available at [JIRAKB/JIRA Software Data Center Lexorank Indexing Lag|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+Software+Data+Center+Lexorank+Indexing+Lag].
fields.summary: LexoRank Rebalance causes read/write amplifications on Lucene in JIRA Datacenter

h3. Summary
A user who is a member of the Project Role (Administrators) which has been added to the *Administer Project* permission is unable to edit the Project Lead. According to the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/managing-project-permissions-185729636.html], the *Administer Project* permission allows any user w/ the permission to edit the Project Lead:
bq. Permission to administer a project in JIRA. This includes the ability to edit project role membership, project components, project versions and some project details ('Project Name', 'URL', 'Project Lead', 'Project Description').

However, with this bug, a user with the *Administer Project* permission is unable to edit the Project Lead. No errors -appear in the UI or- in the logs.

As of JIRA 7.2.0-OD-05, receiving the following Error when trying to change the Project Lead or Default Assignee as a Project Admin:
!EditProjectLeadorAssignee.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project and grant the user Project Administration permission
# Login to the instance as the user and navigate to project settings > Users and Roles
# Click on "Edit Defaults"
# Change project lead to another user
# Click "Update"

h3. Expected Results
-The update completes and pop-up window closes.- User is able to update changes to Project Lead and you see the Project Lead correctly updated on the page. 

h3. Actual Results
-The update button does not respond. You will see a brief spinning wheel, but the "Update" button does not actually update the user.-

Receiving an error indicating "You must have global administrator rights in order to modify the project key."

Looking in the logs with {{com.atlassian.jira.security}} DEBUG, all the permissions clear:
{code}
2016-03-04 17:28:28.883949500 2016-03-04 17:28:28,881 http-nio-2990-exec-227 DEBUG rfuerst 1048x24557x1 39fl15 4.15.43.214,10.85.161.148,127.0.0.1 /secure/project/EditProjectLeadAndDefaultAssignee.jspa [c.a.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager] BROWSE_PROJECTS permission granted by permission scheme
2016-03-04 17:28:28.883951500 2016-03-04 17:28:28,881 http-nio-2990-exec-227 DEBUG rfuerst 1048x24557x1 39fl15 4.15.43.214,10.85.161.148,127.0.0.1 /secure/project/EditProjectLeadAndDefaultAssignee.jspa [c.a.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager] ADMINISTER_PROJECTS permission granted by permission scheme
2016-03-04 17:28:28.883991500 2016-03-04 17:28:28,881 http-nio-2990-exec-227 DEBUG rfuerst 1048x24557x1 39fl15 4.15.43.214,10.85.161.148,127.0.0.1 /secure/project/EditProjectLeadAndDefaultAssignee.jspa [c.a.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager] BROWSE_PROJECTS permission granted by permission scheme
2016-03-04 17:28:28.883997500 2016-03-04 17:28:28,881 http-nio-2990-exec-227 DEBUG rfuerst 1048x24557x1 39fl15 4.15.43.214,10.85.161.148,127.0.0.1 /secure/project/EditProjectLeadAndDefaultAssignee.jspa [c.a.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager] ADMINISTER_PROJECTS permission granted by permission scheme
{code}

h3.Workaround
If you add the user to the {{administrators}} group, they will be able to edit the Project Lead. Or if that is not possible, another project administrator in the {{administrators}} group can make the change.
fields.summary: JIRA Cloud - Project administrator cannot edit Project Lead

fields.description:
{info}This is *not* a support request. This is a bug report found by ALM Works developers on a test instance of JIRA, with technical findings. Please assign this ticket to a developer.{info}

On our test JIRA instance (JIRA 7.1.2), we've encountered a case where any administration page in JIRA would fail to render. All non-administrative pages render normally, however. The problem is that the request serving threads participate in a deadlock.

Example stack trace: 
{code}"http-nio-8080-exec-24" #111 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007efd3186b000 nid=0x132 waiting on condition [0x00007efd1802f000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x00000000dc306748> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock$NonfairSync)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.parkAndCheckInterrupt(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:836)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquireQueued(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:870)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquire(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:1199)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock$NonfairSync.lock(ReentrantLock.java:209)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock.lock(ReentrantLock.java:285)
	at com.atlassian.beehive.simple.SingleNodeLock.lock(SingleNodeLock.java:60)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.DefaultReindexMessageManager.getMessage(DefaultReindexMessageManager.java:170)
	at jsp.decorators.admin_jsp._jspService(admin_jsp.java:315)
	at org.apache.jasper.runtime.HttpJspBase.service(HttpJspBase.java:70)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:725)
...{code}

Any thread that serves a request to an administrative page becomes locked on the same lock without progress.

This lock is taken by this thread, which is also locked:
{code}
"http-nio-8080-exec-14" #99 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007efd30ed2800 nid=0x126 waiting on condition [0x00007efd19057000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x00000000d2700198> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock$NonfairSync)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.parkAndCheckInterrupt(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:836)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquireQueued(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:870)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquire(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:1199)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock$NonfairSync.lock(ReentrantLock.java:209)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock.lock(ReentrantLock.java:285)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.lockedGetOrLoad(LocalCache.java:2218)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.get(LocalCache.java:2197)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache.get(LocalCache.java:3937)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$LocalManualCache.get(LocalCache.java:4739)
	at com.atlassian.cache.memory.DelegatingCache.get(DelegatingCache.java:173)
	at com.atlassian.cache.memory.DelegatingCache.get(DelegatingCache.java:158)
	at com.atlassian.jira.propertyset.CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.resolve(CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.java:111)
	at com.atlassian.jira.propertyset.CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.getType(CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.java:141)
	at com.atlassian.jira.propertyset.CachingOfBizPropertySet.exists(CachingOfBizPropertySet.java:139)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.DefaultReindexMessageManager.getMessage(DefaultReindexMessageManager.java:175)
	at jsp.decorators.admin_jsp._jspService(admin_jsp.java:315)
	at org.apache.jasper.runtime.HttpJspBase.service(HttpJspBase.java:70)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:725)
...
{code}

It is not apparent which thread has locked the Guava  cache segment. However, there's also another thread locked on the same segment:

{code}"Caesium-1-3" #148 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007efd39918000 nid=0x156 waiting on condition [0x00007efd2aa16000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x00000000d2700198> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock$NonfairSync)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.parkAndCheckInterrupt(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:836)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquireQueued(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:870)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquire(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:1199)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock$NonfairSync.lock(ReentrantLock.java:209)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock.lock(ReentrantLock.java:285)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.remove(LocalCache.java:3067)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache.remove(LocalCache.java:4173)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$LocalManualCache.invalidate(LocalCache.java:4765)
	at com.atlassian.cache.memory.DelegatingCache.remove(DelegatingCache.java:237)
	at com.atlassian.jira.propertyset.CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.invalidateCacheEntry(CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.java:239)
	at com.atlassian.jira.propertyset.CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.removeEntry(CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.java:160)
	at com.atlassian.jira.propertyset.CachingOfBizPropertySet.remove(CachingOfBizPropertySet.java:165)
	at com.atlassian.sal.jira.pluginsettings.JiraPluginSettings.putActual(JiraPluginSettings.java:24)
	at com.atlassian.sal.core.pluginsettings.AbstractStringPluginSettings.put(AbstractStringPluginSettings.java:97)
	at com.atlassian.upm.core.impl.NamespacedPluginSettings.put(NamespacedPluginSettings.java:34)
	at com.atlassian.upm.notification.PluginSettingsNotificationCache.saveNotifications(PluginSettingsNotificationCache.java:325)
...
{code}

Note that this thread holds the OneShotLatch lock, acquired in {{DelegatingCache.acquireLockFor()}}. And there's another thread that is waiting to acquire this lock:

{code}
"Caesium-1-2" #147 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007efd38a64000 nid=0x155 waiting on condition [0x00007efd2a59d000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x00000000e7747500> (a com.atlassian.cache.impl.OneShotLatch$Sync)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.parkAndCheckInterrupt(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:836)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.doAcquireShared(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:967)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquireShared(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:1283)
	at com.atlassian.cache.impl.OneShotLatch.await(OneShotLatch.java:31)
	at com.atlassian.cache.memory.DelegatingCache.acquireLockFor(DelegatingCache.java:455)
	at com.atlassian.cache.memory.DelegatingCache.remove(DelegatingCache.java:234)
	at com.atlassian.jira.propertyset.CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.invalidateCacheEntry(CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.java:239)
	at com.atlassian.jira.propertyset.CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.removeEntry(CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.java:160)
	at com.atlassian.jira.propertyset.CachingOfBizPropertySet.remove(CachingOfBizPropertySet.java:165)
	at com.atlassian.sal.jira.pluginsettings.JiraPluginSettings.putActual(JiraPluginSettings.java:24)
	at com.atlassian.sal.core.pluginsettings.AbstractStringPluginSettings.put(AbstractStringPluginSettings.java:85)
	at com.atlassian.analytics.client.upload.S3EventUploader.storeLastUploadDate(S3EventUploader.java:91)
	at com.atlassian.analytics.client.upload.S3EventUploader.execute(S3EventUploader.java:84)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.compat.local.LocalOnlyPluginJob.execute(LocalOnlyPluginJob.java:30)
...
{code}


----


I don't have source code for JIRA 7.1.2 at the moment, but by looking into sources of {{atlassian-cache-memory-2.11.1}} (supplied with JIRA 7.1.9), I've noticed indeed a deadlock situation where locks are acquired in different order:

{{DelegatingCache.remove()}}:
- {{acquireLockFor(key)}}
- {{internalCache.invalidate()}} — acquires segment lock internally
{{DelegatingCache.get()}}: 
- {{internalCache.get()}} — acquires segment lock internally
- {{acquireLockFor(key)}}

It might be that this problem is related. Needs more thorough investigation.
fields.summary: Deadlock in DelegatingCache

# Now , click a new ticket , for example TEST-48 :-

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63831].
  {panel}

Problem:

Comment field's Wiki Style renderer is not consistent. If there's a file attached on the issue, the Attachment button is available. However, when there's no attachment, the Wiki Style renderer will not show the Attachment button.


Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a Screen and associate it to a transition
# Transition an issue and observe the screens that will pop up
# If there's an existing file attached on the issue before transitioning the ticket, the Attachment button in the Comment field's Wiki Style renderer is there.
# If no attachment is uploaded on the issue prior to transitioning the issue, the button is missing.


Expected behaviour:
The attachment button in the Wiki Style Renderer should be consistently present regardless of a file is attached on the issue or not. 


Actual Behaviour:
It seems that the appearance of the Attachment button in the Wiki Style Renderer of Comment field depends on the presence/absence of a file in the ticket
fields.summary: Attachment link on the Wiki Style Rendered is  Missing

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you are using license from Plugin vendor directly (not a Atlassian issued license) and install evaluation license for JIRA ServiceDesk or JIRA Software, then it might break license for that plugin. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup new JIRA Core + Software
# Add licence key - 10000 users (1 used)
# Install *Salesforce & JIRA Server Connector* plugin (problem reported for this plugin, could be not limited to it)
# Add licence key issue by Vendor, this is key point. Key issued by Atlassian works fine.
# Install JIRA Service Desk
# Add SD Evaluation licence -  JIRA Service Desk 3.2.2 Unlimited agents, License type: Evaluation
# Check plugin - ok 
# Restart JIRA
# Check plugin - not licensed (x)
#* Error: _This license supports 10000 users but the Atlassian license allows unlimited users._

h3. Expected Results
Adding evaluation license will not break plugin. 

h3. Actual Results
Adding evaluation license breaks plugin
 
h3. Notes
* This is not pure Atlassian Jira bug, but could be mis-usage of API from vendor side. We encourage vendor to contact us and check that. 

notes on Licensing 
From: https://www.atlassian.com/licensing/purchase-licensing
bq.  Evaluation keys are for the highest user tier available and are compatible across stand-alone product/add-on user tiers and license types.

A note about add-ons
bq. For any add-ons in your instance .. you must still purchase the add-on licensing tier that matches the highest JIRA application tier. ... For example, if you have 500 JIRA Software users and 20 of those users also are licensed for JIRA Service Desk, you only need to purchase an add-on license for 500 users, not 520 users.

h3.Workaround
* Use Atlassian License for plugin
fields.summary: Installing evaluation license for one of JIRA application could break license for plugins

fields.description:
h3. +*Summary*+

When trying to enable JIRA to run on service using below command, it does not take in the input provided. Based on the input below, the service name should be "JIRASW7_3_0, however it is creating a service name with a hardcoded name in service.bat.

Note that this was working with JIRA 7.2.6, but it is not working for JIRA 7.3:
{code}service.bat install JIRASW7_3_0{code}

h3. +*Expected Results*+

After executing the command below, we should see the service name = "JIRASW7_3_0".

{code}service.bat install JIRASW7_3_0{code}

h3. +*Actual Results*+

Regardless of the input provided, it will create the service name as JIRASoftware120117184653 as hard-coded in the service.bat. For example:

*+7.3 service.bat code responsible for this:+*
{code}

set SERVICE_NAME=JIRASoftware120117184653
set DISPLAYNAME=Atlassian JIRA

if "x%1x" == "xx" goto displayUsage
set SERVICE_CMD=%1
shift
if "x%1x" == "xx" goto checkServiceCmd
:checkUser
if "x%1x" == "x/userx" goto runAsUser
if "x%1x" == "x--userx" goto runAsUser
set SERVICE_NAME=JIRASoftware120117184653
set DISPLAYNAME=Atlassian JIRA
{code}

*+7.2.6 service.bat code that is working with user input:+*
{code}
set SERVICE_NAME=JIRACore091216145826
set DISPLAYNAME=Atlassian JIRA

if "x%1x" == "xx" goto displayUsage
set SERVICE_CMD=%1
shift
if "x%1x" == "xx" goto checkServiceCmd
:checkUser
if "x%1x" == "x/userx" goto runAsUser
if "x%1x" == "x--userx" goto runAsUser
set SERVICE_NAME=%1
set DISPLAYNAME=Apache Tomcat 8.0 %1
{code}

h3. +*Workaround*+
Modify the code in 7.3 service.bat as below.

* Locate the following lines in service.bat {code}if "x%1x" == "x--userx" goto runAsUser
set SERVICE_NAME=JIRASoftware120117184653{code}
* Modify the lines to the following:{code}if "x%1x" == "x--userx" goto runAsUser
set SERVICE_NAME=%1{code}
fields.summary: JIRA 7.3 windows service name is hardcoded in service.bat

*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63817].
{panel}
Steps to reproduce:
 * Create a screen with two tabs: "Field Tab" and "Tab 2"
 * Add custom fields to Tab 2.
 * The second tab doesn't get reflected into the view issue screen and all fields appear on a single tab.

In order for the tabs to display, both tabs need a value on the custom field. If you have 2+ tabs, at least 2 tabs need to have a custom field populated with a value in order for it to display. 
h4. Suggested Resolution

Show tabs as configured on the view issue screen, no matter if/how many tabs have custom fields populated with data.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63810].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update: 23rd December 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA|titleColor=#FFFFFF}
Hi all,

Thanks for participating in this issue, either by voting, commented or just watching. We highly value your feedback in all forms, and through suggestions in jira.atlassian.com is not different. We use this channel often to learn the best we can with how customers use JIRA and how we can continue to improve the experience for as many users as possible.

We have revisited this issue again recently and wanted to reiterate that there are still currently no plans to implement this suggestion, and it is not currently on any JIRA team’s roadmap at this stage.

There are several third party add-ons that solve many of the use cases mentioned below:
* [Profields|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.deiser.jira.profields]
* [JIRA Metadata Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.osoboo.jira-metadata-plugin]
* [JIRA Project Specific Select Field|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/jira.plugin.projectspecificselectfield.jpssf].

Please note that these add-ons are for Server only at this stage. We're looking to improve our JIRA Connect capabilities in the future to enable developers to provide this kind of capacity to Cloud customers, but there are no concrete dates at this stage for the release of these capabilities.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.


Regards,
Kerrod Williams
Kerrod (dot) Williams (at) atlassian (dot) com
Product Manager, JIRA

{panel}

*Original request description:*

As JIRA Administrator I need the ability to create custom fields for project in pretty much the same way as for issues. This way I will be able to store additional information per project and search for projects and issues based on these additional criteria.
fields.summary: Custom fields for Projects

The function to modify workflows as project admin is a fantastic new function.

However not always a good option. 

In the instances of our cmr's the project owners have admin rights on their projects.

however some know what they are doing, there are people messing up the worklows.

 

A solution i would like to propose could be that changing the workflow would be added to the permission scheme.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After installing JIRA or upgrading from a previous version the update button is not shown in the Versions & License page even though there is a newer release available.
 I have found this issue in 7.2.1, 7.2.3 and 7.2.6. The latest version is 7.2.7 and hence the previous ones should have the update button available to allow customers to upgrade to 7.2.7. 

See attached screen shot as a reference on how the button is shown in versions 7.0 / 7.1 and how is not shown in the versions mentioned above.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA 7.2.1
 * JIRA 7.2.3
 * JIRA 7.2.6

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upgrade JIRA from 7.1 to 7.2.1
 # Go to the Versions & License page

 # Install JIRA 7.2.3 or 7.2.6
 # Go to the Versions & License page

h3. Expected Results

The update button should be visible as it was in previous versions such as 7.1. if the customer is not at the very latest release.
h3. Actual Results

Customers cannot update their JIRA version from the Version & License page.
h3. Workaround

The workaround is to use the binary installer instead of using the update button.
fields.summary: Version & License page does not show the update button

fields.description:
Similar to: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-4039
h3. Summary

Cells Copied From a Spreadsheet Get Converted into an Image When pasted in comments on issues
h3. Environment
 * JIRA Core 7.0.0 on Chrome Version Version 55.0.2883.95 (64-bit) (64-bit)
 * JIRA Software Server 7.2.7 on Firefox 52.X

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open browser > access your instance
 # Have a JIRA Core/Software Project
 # Open Excel > Create a table > Copy that table. This also happens with text copied from OneNote objects (see attached images).
 # Open the issue
 # Paste this table in the comment field

h3. Expected Results
 - JIRA should paste the table within the description field.

h3. Actual Results
 - JIRA is attaching the table as an attachment.

 

Notes:
 - Customer reported that they are using Excel 2016.

h3. Workaround

Only workaround found so far is to disable the {{jira-html5-attach-images}} web resources module for {{JIRA Drag and Drop Attachment Plugin}}, however this will prevent copy/pasting actual images directly into the comment section.

Users will still be able to drag and drop images into the issue though as expected.
fields.summary: Cells Copied From a Spreadsheet Get Converted into an Image

fields.description:
h4. *Symptoms*

With high load of reports/dashboard statistics gadgets and lots of issue updates this issue causes high memory pressure and leads to either degraded performance or in worst case out of memory error.
h4. Root cause

DefaultReaderCache is using IndexReader as a key to cache field values. 

Field values for single field on 2M+ issues instances can occupy more than 250MB of RAM and consist of millions of objects.

DefaultReaderCache is using weak keys and soft values to store data. Weak keys uses identity comparison on objects.

IndexReader is reopened after every issue write operation on JIRA and this causes all segment readers to be cloned and as result the values from DefaultReaderCache cannot be used any more. This is happening for all segments even those that haven't been changed.  
h4. Fix

As intermediate fix we will use reader.getCoreCacheKey() as key for the cache. More complex approach with limiting number of stored objects will be prepared in future releases.
fields.summary: Caching of reports data is causing high memory pressure and performance degradation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63800].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Even though Nested Groups is disabled for the external directory configuration, the users in nested groups get counted towards the license

h3. Environment
* Reproducible using Open LDAP
* Issue is reported to have occured also in AD


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link to an External Directory 
# Make sure you have not ticked option to enable nested groups
# Create nested group in the external directory
# Place some users in this nested group
# Sync to JIRA

h3. Expected Results
Users in nested group will not get counted towards the license

h3. Actual Results
Nested users get counted towards the license

h3.Workaround
* Remove users from the nested groups
OR 
* remove the nested group completely
fields.summary: Even though Nested Groups is disabled for the external directory configuration, the users in nested groups get counted towards the license

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, users are not able to email issue page to email address not registered in JIRA. JIRA 7 only able to send issue link.


h3. Suggested Solution

Add function in issue page where users can send the content of the issue page to any email.


h3. Workaround 

Use [Email This Issue|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.metainf.jira.plugin.emailissue/server/overview] plugin.
fields.summary: Add function to email issue page to emails not registered in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63798].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Paste PDF into the editor from clipboard using Chrome does not work.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA 1000.695.1 (Cloud), JIRA 7.3.0 (Server)
 * Chrome 55.0.2883.95
 * macOS Sierra

h3. Steps to Reproduce
h4. Scenario1
 # Copy a PDF file in Finder.app
 # Open a JIRA issue in edit mode
 # Press {{Cmd + V}} in the editor

h4. Scenario2
 # Open Terminal.app
 # Execute the following commands
{code:java}
$ defaults write com.apple.screencapture type pdf
$ killall SystemUIServer
{code}

 # Press {{Command + Control + Shift + 3}} to capture a screenshot into the clipboard
 # Open a JIRA issue in edit mode
 # Press {{Cmd + V}} in the editor

h3. Expected Results

The paste from the clipboard should work correctly in the both scenario.
h3. Actual Results
h4. Scenario1

The PDF wasn't attached to the page and the filename is just pasted as a text.
h4. Scenario2

The paste failed silently.
 If we monitor the step in developer tools, we can see the following JavaScript error.
{code:java}
batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-n…:9238 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'slice' of undefined
    at Object.b.convertBlobToImage (batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-n…:9238)
    at batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-n…:9286
    at new D (batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-n…:9286)
    at batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-n…:9286
    at G (batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-n…:9286)
    at a (batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-n…:9286)
    at batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-n…:9286
    at dispatch (batch.js?locale=ja-JP:120)
    at h (batch.js?locale=ja-JP:112)
{code}
When it comes to some of third-party apps, they try to store images as PDF when copying them into clipboard.
 That's why these scenario should be also considered.
h3. Notes

This problem might be caused by [this browser's spec|https://w3c.github.io/clipboard-apis/#reading-from-clipboard].
 Even though we don't support pasting PDF from clipboard, it would be more user friendly if JIRA could show some error on the UI.
h3. Workaround

Use the other browsers instead.
fields.summary: Paste PDF into the editor from clipboard using Chrome does not work

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63796].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

The URL display in connecting to Oracle page was like this:
{code:java}
<jira-database-config>
  <name>defaultDS</name>
  <delegator-name>default</delegator-name>
  <database-type>oracle10g</database-type>
  <jdbc-datasource>
    <url>jdbc:oracle:thin:@//domain-name:1521:ORCL</url>
    <driver-class>oracle.jdbc.OracleDriver</driver-class>
    <username>jirauser</username>
    <password>jirauser</password>
    <pool-min-size>20</pool-min-size>
    <pool-max-size>20</pool-max-size>
    <pool-max-wait>30000</pool-max-wait>
    <validation-query>select 1 from dual</validation-query>
    <min-evictable-idle-time-millis>60000</min-evictable-idle-time-millis>
    <time-between-eviction-runs-millis>300000</time-between-eviction-runs-millis>
    <pool-max-idle>20</pool-max-idle>
    <pool-remove-abandoned>true</pool-remove-abandoned>
    <pool-remove-abandoned-timeout>300</pool-remove-abandoned-timeout>
    <pool-test-on-borrow>false</pool-test-on-borrow>
    <pool-test-while-idle>true</pool-test-while-idle>
  </jdbc-datasource>
</jira-database-config>{code}

But, the actual URL parameter display in {{dbconfig.xml}} is this:
{code}
<url>jdbc:oracle:thin:@//domain-name:1521/ORCL</url>
{code}

As you can see, "/" are the correct one instead of ":".

*Update the page:*
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer073/Connecting+JIRA+applications+to+Oracle
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer072/Connecting+JIRA+applications+to+Oracle
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Connecting+JIRA+applications+to+Oracle
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Connecting+JIRA+applications+to+Oracle
https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/connecting-jira-to-oracle-720411753.html
fields.summary: Update our Connecting to Oracle URL parameter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63795].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The Base URL Health Check in JIRA makes an HTTP request to the base URL. However, in some scenarios, the request will get caught in a circular reference to itself due to redirects in the SSO and SAML configuration.

The following appears in {{atlassian-jira.log}}:
{code:java}
2017-01-02 14:15:57,020 SupportHealthCheckThread-4 ERROR ServiceRunner     [c.a.j.p.healthcheck.support.BaseUrlHealthCheck] An error occurred when performing the Base URL healthcheck: 
org.apache.http.client.ClientProtocolException
	at org.apache.http.impl.client.InternalHttpClient.doExecute(InternalHttpClient.java:186)
	at org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient.execute(CloseableHttpClient.java:82)
	at org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient.execute(CloseableHttpClient.java:107)
	at org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient.execute(CloseableHttpClient.java:55)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.healthcheck.support.BaseUrlHealthCheck.doCheck(BaseUrlHealthCheck.java:52)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.healthcheck.support.AbstractSupportHealthCheck.check(AbstractSupportHealthCheck.java:27)
	at com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.impl.PluginSuppliedSupportHealthCheck.check(PluginSuppliedSupportHealthCheck.java:41)
	at com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.thread.HealthCheckCallable.call(HealthCheckCallable.java:32)
	at com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.thread.HealthCheckCallable.call(HealthCheckCallable.java:15)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: org.apache.http.client.CircularRedirectException: Circular redirect to 'base-url/jira'
	at org.apache.http.impl.client.DefaultRedirectStrategy.getLocationURI(DefaultRedirectStrategy.java:176)
	at org.apache.http.impl.client.DefaultRedirectStrategy.getRedirect(DefaultRedirectStrategy.java:220)
	at org.apache.http.impl.execchain.RedirectExec.execute(RedirectExec.java:121)
	at org.apache.http.impl.client.InternalHttpClient.doExecute(InternalHttpClient.java:184)
	... 12 more
{code}

h5. Environment:
 * JIRA, listening on a context path of {{https://base-url/jira/}}
 * A SAML/SSO product responding to {{https://base-url/saml/}}

h5.Diagnosis
Performing a cURL to the base URL shows a redirect loop (extraneous headers stripped for clarity):
{code:java}
% curl -I -L https://base-url/jira

HTTP/1.1 302 Found
Date: Mon, 09 Jan 2017 08:52:28 GMT
Server: Apache
Location: https://base-url/saml

HTTP/1.1 302 Moved Temporarily
Cache-Control: private
Date: Mon, 09 Jan 2017 08:52:28 GMT
Location: https://base-url/jira

HTTP/1.1 302 Found
Date: Mon, 09 Jan 2017 08:52:28 GMT
Server: Apache
Location: https://base-url/saml

HTTP/1.1 302 Moved Temporarily
Cache-Control: private
Date: Mon, 09 Jan 2017 08:52:28 GMT
Location: https://base-url/jira

HTTP/1.1 302 Found
Date: Mon, 09 Jan 2017 08:52:28 GMT
Server: Apache
Location: https://base-url/saml

HTTP/1.1 302 Moved Temporarily
Cache-Control: private
Date: Mon, 09 Jan 2017 08:52:28 GMT
Location: https://base-url/jira
{code}
In the scenario this issue is derived from, the customer had whitelisted calls to the REST API to not go through the SAML/SSO configuration. This means that while gadgets worked correctly, the Health Check failed due to the circular reference.

h3. Suggested Solution

Update the check to query the gadget spec URL instead of the base URL, and rename it appropriately.

Alternatively for customers who are not able to make the modifications to exclude all requests from JIRA, it'd be great to either allow or just test an extra URL, either in addition to or instead of the current URL for testing which is the base URL.

Being able to detect circular redirects or too many redirects would also be a really good improvement to this health check.

h3. Workaround
For customers who do not wish to see or be alerted by the failing health check, you can take the following steps:
 # Go to Manage Add-ons
 # Select All add-ons and search for "Instance Health Plugin"
 # Expand the plugin and then expand the modules
 # Disable {{jira.healthcheck.baseurl.name}}
fields.summary: The JIRA Base URL Healthcheck can fail in certain SSO/SAML scenarios despite the gadgets URL working correctly

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Prior to the release of JIRA 7.3, each release of JIRA Software or JIRA Service Desk was marked as compatible with all minor versions of the same release. 
 For example, JIRA Software 7.2.6 was compatible with JIRA Core 7.2.0-7.2.6

Since the release of JIRA 7.3.0 these have been marked with a 1:1 relationship. JIRA Software 7.2.6 is now only marked as compatible with JIRA Core 7.2.6.

See the marketplace listings: 
 [JIRA Software|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.jira-software-application/versions?_ga=1.205770896.265181632.1430841443] 
 [JIRA Service Desk|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.servicedesk.application/versions?_ga=1.237263875.265181632.1430841443]
h3. Environment

JIRA 7.2 onwards
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install JIRA Software 7.2.0 using the installer
 # Update JIRA Software by uploading the JIRA Softare 7.2.6 obr

h3. Expected Results

There should be no warning messages.
h3. Actual Results

The message “JIRA Core must be updated to be compatible with this version of JIRA Software” appears, although this was previously not present.
h3. Notes

Many users will be experiencing this issue although it was previously encouraged to upgrade the versions of JIRA Software in this manner.
h3. Workaround

There should be no impact in functionality, if you previously had this configuration and are just seeing this message.

Alternatively, upgrade you version of JIRA Software or JIRA Service desk using the installer. See [Upgrading JIRA Applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer072/Upgrading+JIRA+applications] for full details.

This was also affecting 8.2.4 on 7/18/2019 but has been fixed through a Marketplace update.
fields.summary: Versions & Licenses page displays error 'Jira Core must be updated to be compatible with this version of Jira Software'
Toggle a field

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Cannot use Visual tab (Text tab works) anymore after cancelling the previous comment on IE11.
h3. Environment
 * IE 11
 * JIRA 7.3+

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to an issue page
 # Type a comment (Visual mode)
 # Cancel it
 # Try to type another comment

h3. Expected Results

One can type the comment in the Visual tab, ie. characters are visible.
h3. Actual Results

The content is not visible (blank/white space).
h3. Notes
Only in JIRA 7.3.0, we can reproduce the issue without cancelling the previous comment. Typing a comment after adding a comment will get the same output.
 
h3. Workaround
 * refresh the page
 * switch to Text mode
fields.summary: As RTE user I want to add a comment after cancelling the previous one on the same page using IE11
